line_1: Tho' what your merit might deserve,
line_2: I chill'd you not with cold reserve,

line_1: Not more than others I deserve,
line_2: For I have Food while others starve,

line_1: Such Scorn we may expect, nay we deserve,
line_2: When wanton Souls from steddy Vertue swerve.

line_1: Form'd for ingratitude, would ill deserve
line_2: For she, who could a tranquil mind preserve,

line_1: Who acts by force impell'd, can nought deserve;
line_2: And wisdom short of infinite may swerve.

line_1: " Nor can it from thee this reproach deserve
line_2: "And ever will its tender mansion serve,

line_1: If God should judge us, as our faults deserve!
line_2: And think, what pangs would rack each throbbing nerve,
